Heat the olive oil in a large pot over medium heat. Stir in the onion, and season with bay leaves, cumin, oregano, and salt. Cook and stir until onion is tender, then mix in the celery, green bell peppers, jalapeno peppers, garlic, and green chile peppers. Reduce heat to low, cover pot, and simmer 5 minutes.

1 hr
Mix the tomatoes into the pot. Season chili with chili powder and pepper. Stir in the kidney beans, garbanzo beans, and black beans. Bring to a boil, reduce heat to low, and simmer 45 minutes. Stir in the corn, and continue cooking 5 minutes before serving.

5 mins
Serve, then top with cheese and sour cream.

Ingredients.Name:
Wow! This looks great - and so thorough! Can't wait to try!
Reply

Thanks ! I hope you will enjoy it ! By the way, I just remembered that when shaping the croissants, you need to tuck the tip of the triangle under the croissants. I heard that they might unroll if you don't do this.
Reply

Preparation.Step:
10 hrs
Mix together all the ingredients for the levain and let the mix rest for 8 to 12 hours, or until doubled/tripled in size and bursted bubbles are present on the top.

5 mins
Warm up the water and milk mixture (until it feels not too cold not too warm when you dip a finger in) and dissolve the dry yeast in.

5 mins
Mix all the ingredients for the dough in a bowl and knead until combined.

30 mins
Let the dough rest on the counter for 20 to 30 minutes.

5 mins
After 30 minutes, knead again until soft and smooth. This should be fairly fast and easy after the 30 minute' rest.

10 hrs
Cover the bowl (don't cover the dough tightly at this stage as it will rise) and let it rest in the fridge overnight.

5 mins
The next day, roll the rolling butter into a square of approximately 15 cm x 15 cm x 0.5 cm. For this, put the butter cut into pieces of approximately 1 cm of thickness into a piece of baking paper and fold the edges of the paper so as to form a square of 15 cm x 15 cm. Then smash and roll the butter with a rolling pin until it spreads to the desired shape.

5 mins
Get the dough from the fridge and poke it with one finger. Then, poke your butter layer. Do the two have a similar consistency ? If so, proceed to the next step. If the butter is harder, put the dough back in the fridge and let the butter rest on the counter until it softens. If the dough is harder, put the dough and the butter back into the fridge. If the butter is too soft even after a few hours in the fridge, consider using another brand...

5 mins
Enclose the butter layer in the dough (see this image from thefreshloaf : i78.photobucket.com/album...).
Starting from the center, roll GENTLY from center to corners first. Then elongate the dough from center to side to obtain a rectangle of ratio 1:3. In the beginning, if the dough is hard, you can press on it with the rolling pin instead.

5 mins
Perform the first fold as follows.
Put the dough with the short side facing you. Grab the top portion of the dough (the one furthest from you) and fold it over the two thirds. Then grab the bottom portion and fold it over. A picture is worth a thousand words :).
When rolling, if the butter feels too stiff, let the dough rest on the counter for a while (otherwise, the stiff butter will break up into big chunks and pierce through the layers). If the butter starts to melt, put the dough back in the fridge for 30 minutes (otherwise, the melted butter will stick the layers together, or leak from the dough. Either way, it is not good).
Cover with plastic wrap or a plastic bag (hermetically) and let it rest in the fridge for at least one hour.
A three-layer fold.

5 mins
Get the dough out of the fridge and perform your second and last fold as follows.
Position the dough so that the previous fold is now horizontal. Gently roll the dough from the center and elongate it until a rectangle of ratio 1:4 forms. Fold the top portion to the middle of the rectangle, the bottom portion to the middle also. And fold the two halfs. Have a look at the picture :).
Cover and let the dough rest in the fridge for at least an hour.
A four-layer fold.

5 mins
Roll the dough into a rectangle of approximately 20 cm large and 0.3 to 0.5 cm thickness. The length does not really matter.

8 mins
Cut a series of triangles of 20 cm height, 10 cm long at the base. Take each triangle, slightly stretch it and roll it lengthwise starting from the base. Put the croissant on a rack with the tip tucked under itself, and proceed to the next. You should end up with approximately 6 croissants plus a little extra from the edges.
An example of triangle pattern for croissants. Half rectangles are fine too.
At this point, you can either proof your croissants, or put them back in the fridge overnight and proof them the next day, or freeze them.

1 min
Prepare the egg wash : mix all the ingredients for the egg wash together.

3 hrs
For the proof, brush a layer of egg wash on the croissants, avoiding the layers and let the croissants rest for 2 to 3 hours at approximately 20-25°C (do not go higher than 30°C which is the melting point of butter). I keep mine in a switched off oven.

5 mins
After proofing, the croissants should have doubled in size and be jiggly. The layers should be visible. Brush a second layer of egg wash.

15 mins
Preheat the oven at 220°C and bake for about 15 minutes or until golden brown.

Ingredients.Name: sugar, if used in a sweet recipe optional

Preparation.Step:
5 mins
Cut the butter into chunks of approximately 1x1 cm. It is important that the butter is very cold.

3 mins
Put the chunks of butter in the flour and roughly mix the two until part of the butter is incorporated but you still have chunks of butter (approximately the size of a pea).

5 mins
Add the very cold water little by little and knead until the dough forms a ball. You might need a different quantity of water than the one prescribed here. The dough won't be soft and there will still be large chunks of butter. That is normal and what we are looking for.

2 mins
Roll the dough into a rectangle of ratio 1:3. Perform your first fold as indicated in the picture below.
A simple 3-layer fold.

Rotate the dough with an angle of 90°. Roll out the dough and perform a second 3-layer fold. This makes a total of 9 layers. I find the result crispy enough to my taste but you could perform additional folds if you wish to have more layers (but be aware that the final result won't necessarily be crisipier or flakier with more folds).
Film the dough and let it rest in the fridge for a minimum of an hour before using it.

Ingredients.Name: vegetable oil, more for greasing pan
packed light or dark brown sugar
full-fat sour cream or plain yoghurt

Preparation.Step: Heat the oven to 350 degrees. Oil a 8 ½- or 9-inch loaf pan; line with parchment, leaving a 2-inch overhang on two sides.

In a medium bowl, whisk together the flour, baking powder, cinnamon, salt, and baking soda. In a large bowl, whisk together the vegetable oil, pumpkin puree, granulated sugar, brown sugar, eggs, sour cream, and vanilla. Fold the dry ingredients into the wet ingredients until fully combined. Transfer the batter to the prepared pan and smooth into an even layer.

1 hr, 15 mins
Bake until the loaf is puffed and set, and a skewer inserted into the center comes out with moist crumbs attached, 60 to 75 minutes. Transfer the bread, in the pan, to a rack to cool for 20 minutes. Use a knife to cut the two exposed sides of bread away from the pan, then use the parchment to transfer the cake to the rack. Let cool completely.

Ingredients.Name: Espresso, May omit if you use extra strong coffee optional
Shavings of Unsweetened Dark Chocolate optional

Preparation.Step:
10 mins
Chill Whipping Cream in a bowl.

10 mins
Mix .5 ounces of Rum, Coffee & Espresso in a bowl and chill.

5 mins
Whisk the Whipping Cream until it reaches stiff peaks.

2 mins
Mix Cheese, Sugar & 1.5 ounces of Rum in a bowl until smooth.

2 mins
Fold in the Whipped Cream into the cheese mixture.

5 mins
Soak Lady Fingers in Coffee for a few seconds until saturated (coat all sides).

1 min
Place Lady Fingers side by side on the bottom of an 8x8 pan.

2 mins
Spread half the Mixture over the Lady Fingers & smooth out.

1 min
Sift Cocoa Powder over Mixture.

5 mins
Repeat steps 7-9 on top of the first layer.

1 min
Sprinkle Dark Chocolate Shavings on top.

Ingredients.Name: Chinese cooking wine (shaoxing) or mirin optional
garlic chili paste or 1 teaspoon chili flakes

Preparation.Step:
2 mins
Toast szechuan peppercorns in a hot dry skillet over medium heat, until fragrant, about 1-2 minutes. Crush.

5 mins
Place all ingredients in a medium bowl or small jar and whisk until well combined.
If using as a stir-fry sauce, and you would like to thicken it, whisk in 2 teaspoons cornstarch.
If using as a marinade, forgo the cornstarch and make sure to season what you are marinating with salt. The marinade alone will probably not be salty enough.

Ingredients.Name: unsalted butter, 1 stick/ half a cup
chocolate chips or semi-sweet chocolate, 2/3 cup chopped

Preparation.Step:
5 mins
Melt 4 oz butter and 4 oz unsweetened chocolate together, on the stove over very low heat. Take the chocolate out when it’s almost, but not fully, melted. Off the heat, stir until it is.

10 mins
Whisk the 190 grams brown sugar and 25 grams granulated sugar into melted butter and chocolate, then add the 2 eggs, one at a time, then the 1 teaspoon vanilla. Whisk in 1/2 teaspoon baking soda and 1/2 teaspoon salt. Add 45 grams cocoa powder. Add 130 grams flour, too, and then stir until just combined. Add the 115 grams chocolate chips or chocolate chunks and stir until combined.

45 mins
Place bowl in the fridge for about 30 minutes. Scoop into balls. I did 45 grams each. Bake immediately, or freeze then bake.

15 mins
If frozen, bake at 350°F for 13 minutes.

20 mins
Heat oil in pan. Add channa, cashews and jeera and roast. Don't burn.
Add salt, pinch of turmeric and mix.
Add onions and coriander and fry till onions are translucent.
Add rava and mix thoroughly.
Add 3 cups of water slowly and keep stirring to prevent lumps from being formed.
Once thoroughly mixed, put the lid and let cook for few mins.
If needed add more water.
After desired soft, creamy consistency is reached, add ghee and mix. Then add lemon juice and mix.
Top with fresh coriander, little ghee and serve hot.

Recipes.name: Cemita - the roll for a torta

Preparation.Step:
10 mins
Activate the yeast -- add dry yeast, sugar, and warm water into a mixing bowl. Mix them together and let it activates for 10 minutes.

5 mins
Pour the yeast mixture into a food processor, add in 2 eggs, 2 tablespoons of butter, salt (about 2 tablespoons), 3 cups of flour, and blend that for about 5 minutes. You will get a nice supple and smooth dough.

1 hr
Flour the kneading surface, knead the dough for a little bit until it’s extra smooth and just let that rise in an oiled bowl for 1 hour, doubles it size at room temperature.

1 hr
After it doubles it size, pat that down and let it rise again for another hour.

10 mins
Once that’s done, take out your dough and put it on the floured surface. Roll that out and cut it into a few pieces, and roll those up into balls. Let rest for about 10 minutes.

Rolling out the dough -- position your hand in the chopping position and ROLL them right in the middle to form 2 sides. Make sure one side is a little bit smaller than the other, and it looks like 2 balls (but it’s still attached). Pat them down with your hands, and flip the smaller size on top of the bigger size. Pat it down flat again. Watch the rolling technique in the video here.
forming the roll

1 hr, 15 mins
Put the dough on the baking sheet with parchment paper, brush them with egg wash and sprinkle some sesame seeds on the top. Let them sit and rise for 1 hour.

15 mins
Put them in the oven at 450°F for 15 minutes and you get this nice Cemita roll.

Ingredients.Name: butter, 6 ounces, 1 1/2 sticks. Melt, brown, and cool.

Preparation.Step:
5 mins
In a medium-sized bowl, whisk together the flour, baking soda, cornstarch, and salt. Set aside.
In a large bowl, beat together the cooled melted butter and the sugars with a hand-mixer for about one minute. Then, add in the eggs and vanilla extract. Beat until just combined.

5 mins
Slowly add in the dry ingredients and mix briefly, just until there are no flour clumps left. Fold in the chocolate chips.

30 mins
Cover and refrigerate the dough for 30 minutes to an hour.

1 hr
Roll into balls, sizing of your choice. Freeze for at least one hour, or until ready to bake. Dough can remain frozen for months.

15 mins
Bake for about 10-14 minutes at 325 degrees on parchment-lined bakingsheets, rotating half-way through if you don't have convection, or until the cookies have spread out and the edges are golden, but the centers of the cookies still look soft and undercooked.

15 mins
Let the cookies cool on the baking sheets until the cookies are firm enough to remove, about 15 minutes.

2 mins
In a large bowl, mix the almond powder with the sugar.

5 mins
In a separate bowl, whisk the egg whites with an electric mixer with a pinch of salt until they form soft peaks. As Mr. Lebovitz says : "They should not be stiff, but the consistency of softly whipped cream."

2 mins
Incorporate the egg whites into the dry ingredients. The whites will lose their volume. That's ok.

1 min
Add the jam and mix.

2 mins
optional
If the batter seems too liquidy, mix in two tablespoons of chestnut flour.
Pre-heat the oven to 160°C.

5 mins
Shape the cookies. You have two possibilities here. If you do have a dough solid enough to be kneaded, follow the instructions of DL. If like me you have a batter and not a dough, just use two spoons (or an icecream scooper) to drop little heaps on the cooking tray. Coat the biscuits with almond slices and press gently to stick the slices to the biscuits.

30 mins
Bake the cookies for 25 to 30 minutes (a bit longer in my case because my dough was so wet).

5 mins
De-seed and julienne the bell peppers, and slice the onion into long strips.

10 mins
Heat olive oil in a medium skillet on medium high heat. Add peppers and onions and saute until browned. Let some spots char for a little bonus flavor.

5 mins
Add the sliced sirloin to the skillet with the peppers and onions. Add the paprika, Italian seasoning, and salt and pepper. Saute until the beef is cooked.

5 mins
Transfer the mixture to a separate container. Wipe down the skillet to remove any stray bits, and place a tortilla into the skillet over medium heat. Add a slice of provolone, the beef mixture, and some hot sauce, then top with 2 more provolone slices and another tortilla. Cook until bottom tortilla is starting to brown, and the cheese is melting; flip and cook on other side.
Remove from pan and cut quesadilla into quarters. Serve with some salsa or queso and enjoy!

Recipes.name: Garlic Fried Rice with Vinegar Sauce

Ingredients.Name: Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper, to taste

Preparation.Step:
1 min
Stir vinegar, chile flakes, 1 tbsp. garlic, salt, and pepper in a bowl; set aside.

5 mins
Heat oil in a 12" skillet over medium-high. Cook remaining garlic until just golden, 1-2 minutes. Transfer 2 tbsp. garlic to a plate; set aside.

10 mins
Add rice to skillet; cook, stirring and breaking up any large clumps, until rice is heated through and slightly crisp in places, 5-7 minutes. Season with salt and transfer to a serving platter. Top with fried eggs and serve reserved sauce on the side.

Ingredients.Name: Loaf Texas Toast or any thick bread, approximately 8-10 slices
Fresh Berries -- Blueberries Blackberries and Strawberries
Almond milk for whole milk, for milk free
Tofutti Cream Cheese alternative for creem cheese, for milk free

Preparation.Step: In a small bowl, beat together cream cheese, jam, and lemon zest.
Fold in fresh strawberries. Spoon mixture on piece of bread and top with another piece of bread.

10 mins
In a shallow dish, whisk together milk, eggs, vanilla and brown sugar.
Heat skillet on medium low heat and add 1 Tablespoon of butter per french toast.

10 mins
Working in batches, dip each piece of french toast into custard batter. Let each side soak for about 10 seconds. Add the soaked slices to the sizzling butter in the skillet.
Cook until golden brown -- about 4 minutes per side.
Serve with fresh berries, powdered sugar, whipped cream and real maple syrup.

5 mins
Mix all powders and add to frankie/ sandwich.

15 mins
Preheat oven to 350F.
In a large bowl, stir together flour, baking soda, eggs, brown sugar and fruit cocktail. Pour into a greased 9 inch square baking pan.
Sprinkle with brown sugar and walnuts.

45 mins
Bake until golden. Serve hot.

Recipes.name: Tofu Biryani in the Instant Pot

Preparation.Step:
10 mins
Cut the tofu into 1-inch cubes. In a large bowl, combine the yogurt, ginger paste, minced garlic, cilantro, mint, lime juice, garam masala, fenugreek, ground chili, smoked paprika, cinnamon, salt, and liquid smoke. Mix until well combined. Add the tofu and stir to coat with the marinade.

1 hr
Marinate in the refrigerator for at least 1 hour, or preferably overnight.

15 mins
Turn on the Instant Pot on Sauté mode. Once hot, add the oil and onions. Fry the onions until they turn golden brown, about 15 minutes. Remove the onions from the Instant Pot, transfer to a bowl, and set aside.

5 mins
Heat another tablespoon of oil in the Instant Pot. Add the marinated tofu and red bell peppers, and sauté for about 5 minutes, stirring regularly to prevent the tofu from sticking. Turn the sauté mode off.

15 mins
Add the caramelized onions, rice, water, raisins, cardamom pods, cinnamon stick, bay leaf, and salt on top of the sautéed tofu. Close the lid and pressure cook on manual for 1 minute. After 1 minute, let the pressure release naturally, this should take around 10 minutes. Remove the lid and fluff with a fork.
Serve immediately topped with fresh cilantro, lime, and/or a dollop of yogurt.
Cebule drobno pokrój w kostkę i podsmaż w garnku na oleju.
Gdy cebula zrobi się szklista dodaj mąkę i całość zasmaż.
Następnie wlej bulion, dodaj kiełbasę i przyprawę Knorr. Całość gotuj około 20 minut. Po tym czasie kiełbasę wyjmij, lekko wystudź i pokrój w plastry.
Jaja ugotuj na twardo, następnie posiekaj lub zetrzyj na tarce.
Do wywaru dodaj chrzan oraz śmietanę i gotuj ponownie około 15 minut, aż zupa przejdzie smakiem chrzanu.

1 hr
Tuż przed podaniem dodaj do zupy pokrojoną kiełbasę oraz posiekane jajka. Podawaj z natką pietruszki.

Ingredients.Name: vanilla bean, (or any kind of vanilla flavoring you have at hand : powdered vanilla, vanilla extract, vanilla flavored sugar... If possible, you should use some good quality vanilla as this will provide the main flavor of the cream).
brown sugar or caster sugar, (or any kind of powdered sugar if you don't have it)

Preparation.Step:
5 mins
Cut the vanilla bean in half and extract all the seeds by sliding a knife on the cut halves. Skip this step if you're using not using a vanilla bean.

10 mins
Pour the liquid cream in a pot, together with the empty vanilla bean and heat it gently to extract the aromas from the bean. If you're using vanilla extract, I would skip this step. If you're using powdered vanilla, follow the steps with a few pinches of vanilla powder.

5 mins
Meanwhile, beat the yolks with the sugar and the vanilla seeds (if you're using vanilla extract or powder, add some instead) until the mix whitens. Try not to incorporate too much air in the mix, as this will make the cream less smooth !
Preheat the oven at 100°C.

5 mins
Pour in the COOLED liquid cream progressively through a strainer (not necessary if you're not using vanilla beans) in the yolk-sugar mix while mixing. It is very important to wait until the liquid cream has cooled down because otherwise the yolks with start to foam, thus making the cream less smooth (still edible and good though, so don't throw everything away if the mix is a bit foamy).
Pour the cream into as many ramequins as servings.

1 hr
Cook the creams in the oven at 100°C for an hour.
Get the creams out of the oven. The consistency should be similar to that of a soft, trembling pudding.

4 hrs, 30 mins
Let them cool down on a rack, then in the fridge for at least four hours. You can prepare them in one or two days of advance without a problem.

When you are ready to eat them, get them out of the fridge. Spill some sugar on top (a bit less than a tablespoon) and caramelize the sugar with a kitchen torch. To caramelize the tops efficiently without heating the cream underneath too much (and ruining its texture), the best is to first melt the sugar by moving the torch back and forth at a relatively low power, THEN caramelize the liquefied sugar as fast as possible by torching it with a high power setting. Ultimately, just do your best and most importantly : do not burn yourself !

2 mins
Spread the hazelnuts on a sheet of baking paper.

15 mins
Bake the hazelnuts at 180 °C (350 °F) for 12 - 15 minutes.

10 mins
Wait for the hazelnuts to cool down enough to be able to hold them in your hand. You'll hear the hazelnuts crackling while they cool down - this is normal.

45 mins
Using your hands, rub the hazelnuts together to clean the skin off.

5 mins
Sanizite the glass containers by heating them in the oven at 200 °C (390 °F) for 5 minutes.

1 min
Load the hazelnuts into the blender. At this point they may seem cool on the outside, but inside they're still warm which is important to be able to blend them into a nice butter.

2 mins
Blend with short high-speed bursts until you no longer see whole hazelnuts.

5 mins
Blend at low/medium until it almost looks like a liquid.

2 mins
Add the Agava Syrup and blend at low speed for a couple of minutes.

10 mins
By now the containers should no longer be hot and you can fill them with the hazelnut butter you just made.

2 hrs
Let the butter cool for a few hours. You may want to put a paper towel over the containers to shield them from dust.

1 min
Once cool, close the containers tightly and store in a dark, dry place. Eat within 3 weeks.

10 mins
Mash everything together with a fork!
Serve on bread or lettuce. Even better the next day!

Ingredients.Name: queso fresco, cut up into bite sized chunks

Preparation.Step:
45 mins
Pre-prep: roast the Anaheim Chile on an open flame until black on all the skin. Take off flame, allow to cool, remove charred skin, stems, and seeds (keep some seeds if you want your soup spicy)
Preparation:
1) heat oil and sauté onion and garlic together until fragrant and onions are starting to turn translucent.
2) add tomato and sauté until soft.
3) add the potatoes, salt, pepper, and oregano and mix everything together.
4) after the potatoes have cooked for 2-3 minutes, add water and bullion. At this point you should taste what you have to decide if you need more seasoning.
5) cover the pot with a lid and let come to a boil. Let potatoes cook for 20-30 minutes.
6) While potatoes cook, cut the Anaheim Chile into strips. Once the potatoes are cooked, add Anaheim Chile.
7) Once Anaheim Chile’s are added, slowly mix in the milk and then add the Queso Fresco.
8) Cook for another 5 minutes, mixing once in that time to ensure the Queso Fresco doesn’t stick to the bottom.
9) serve warm, heat up a tortilla with it, and enjoy!

Recipes.name: Black Bean and Cheese Enchiladas with Ranchero Sauce

Ingredients.Name: spicy pepper, chopped. original recipe calls for dried, but I usuall use jalepeno
fresh chopped oregano, sub 1 T dried
canned black beans (1 can), rinsed and drained

Preparation.Step:
5 secs
Preheat oven to 400°.

15 mins
Heat oil in a medium saucepan over high heat. Add onion and spicy pepper; saute 1 minute. Reduce heat to medium; add garlic and salt. Cook 5 minutes or until golden, stirring occasionally. Add broth, tomato paste, oregano, and cumin; cook 8 minutes or until thickened, stirring occasionally.

3 mins
Blend mixture with an immersion blender until smooth; stir in lime juice and red pepper.

10 mins
Combine the beans, 1 cup cheese, and half the green onions in a bowl. Spread 1/2 cup sauce in the bottom of a 13 x 9-inch glass or ceramic baking dish coated with cooking spray. Warm tortillas according to package directions. Spoon 3 tablespoons bean mixture down center of each tortilla; roll up. Place, seam-side down, in prepared dish.

15 mins
Pour remaining sauce over filled tortillas. Top with the remaining cheese. Bake at 400° for 15 minutes or until lightly browned.

5 mins
Sprinkle with remaining green onions; serve with sour cream.

Ingredients.Name: spray cooking oil, I used olive oil spray

Preparation.Step:
5 mins
For the batter: combine flour, cornstarch, and baking powder in a medium bowl. Beat in 1 egg, and pour in beer and mix until smooth.

20 mins
Cover mixture in plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 20 minutes.

5 mins
For the dredge: add flour to a shallow dredging pan, and cover with paprika, cajun seasoning, salt, and pepper. Stir together to combine and add a bit more of everything to the top of the mixture.

5 mins
Slice fillets into 1-inch wide strips (against the grain). Pat strips dry with a paper towel.

10 mins
Dredge filet strips, then cover completely in batter. Allow all excess batter to drop off, and then dredge again.

3 mins
Preheat air fryer to 390° for at least 3 minutes.
Spray breaded strips with cooking oil liberally, until all flour is coated. Place strips in air fryer baskets, making sure they don't touch each other.

5 mins
Fry for 5 minutes.

1 min
optional
If there are any dry spots, spray with more cooking oil and fry for an additional 1 minute.
Serve with lemon and malt vinegar, or on some delicious tacos.

Recipes.name: BEST Southern Home Fried Potatoes and Sausage Recipe

Preparation.Step:
20 mins
Peel and slice 5 large potatoes. (slice potatoes in half then slice about a 1/4 inch thick). Put your potatoes in a bowl and coat them with 2 Tbsp of olive oil. Then slice your sausage link about the same width and set aside in a separate dish.

10 mins
In a skillet on Medium heat, add 2 Tbsp of olive oil. Brown up one side of your sliced sausage. Once you flip them to brown the other side, add in 1 cup of chopped onion. When the onion is translucent and the sausage is browned on both sides, remove it from the pan and set aside.

In that same pan add in 1 can of drained green beans. Then add in 1 Tbsp, of minced garlic. Once cooked (The canned green beans are already cooked so this won't take long), place green beans aside with your sausage and onions.

5 mins
In the same skillet, add 2 Tbs olive oil and add your sliced potatoes. Fry the potatoes until both sides are golden brown and fork tender. Season the potatoes with salt, pepper, and red pepper.
(cook potatoes in a single layer. Split in two parts if they don't all fit in the pan as a single batch)

5 mins
Add in your Sausage, onion and green beans and let it cook for a couple more minutes.
Garnish with chives...and it's done!

5 mins
Warm the pan over medium-low heat, add the olive oil, and heat oil. Add garlic, oregano, pepper, and salt. Cook until garlic is lightly browned, not burnt.

7 mins
Increase heat to high. Add tomatoes, then cut tomatoes with kitchen scissors, at least into quarters. Let the sauce sit for a little, mix it around, let it get hot. Stir constantly. Aggressively. Make sure the spices get mixed throughout, and the heat begins to release the flavor in the tomatoes. Start first taste tests now. Keep cutting as it cooks, make it all uniform. Eliminate any large chunks and outliers. Bring it to a boil essentially.

1 min
Add the tomato paste. Mix it in. Turn the heat down to low. Keep stirring. Never stop.

1 hr
Let it sit over the lowest heat. Cover with a lid, but let it breath. You can let it cook over low for up to 3 hours. Or, you can cook on low for about 10 minutes, then turn the heat to medium for about ten. Great results when you cook for about 45 minutes at this point, but the longer the better.

10 mins
Bring water, butter, and a pinch of salt to a boil. Take off the heat and stir in couscous. Cover and let sit for 10 minutes.

5 mins
Fluff up couscous with a fork, and toss with orange zest, nuts, fruit, and herbs. Add oil if needed. Top with onions, if using. Serve at any temperature.

Recipes.name: Instant Pot Cod with Nectarine Cherry Salsa

Preparation.Step: Fill Instant Pot with 1 cup of water. Place trivet in pot, and place cod fillets on trivet. Season fillets with salt and pepper.

4 mins
Set Instant Pot to Manual for 4 minutes.

10 mins
The Instant Pot will take around 10 minutes to get up to pressure.

2 mins
Combine diced nectarine, diced cherries, and cilantro in a small bowl. Zest and juice the lime into the bowl. Stir to combine.

5 mins
When Instant Pot is finished cooking, do a natural release for 5 minutes, and then quick release.
Plate fillets and spoon the salsa on top. Enjoy!

Ingredients.Name: softened butter, you can use salted or unsalted butter
Plus melted butter to brush the bread

Preparation.Step:
5 mins
combine dry ingredients in a bowl and mix until uniform

5 mins
add egg, pineapple juice vanilla

2 mins
stand mixer dough attachment for speed 1

7 mins
speed 2
add 1/4 cup softened butter

5 mins
turn out into an oiled bowl / form into a ball

45 mins
let it rest until doubled in size
degas the dough by turning it into a bowl
flatten to rectangle - divide into 16 pieces

15 mins
form into a ball and cover for 15 minutes
flatten out to eliminate gas
roll each ball (second time) / pinch seam to seal and roll under your palm

30 mins
place in a pan w/parchment paper / rest 30 minutes (9x9 Square Pan)
brush with eggwash (1 egg + 2 TBS milk)

23 mins
Bake at 355 for 20-23 minutes until golden brown
brush with melted / salted butter while still hot

Ingredients.Name: herbs and spices of your choice optional

Preparation.Step: Preheat oven to 240°C

5 mins
Mix all the dry ingredients together.

10 mins
Add the yoghurt and knead until combined.

5 mins
Sprinkle some flour on a cooking tray and flatten the dough with your fingers into a circular shape (of desired size and thickness).

10 mins
Add your favorite toppings and cook for 10 to 15 minutes

For the pudding:
Preheat oven to 350°F. Grease and flour the baking pan.

10 mins
In a medium saucepan, combine water and dates and bring to a boil. Remove from heat and stir in baking soda until mixture becomes foamy. Set aside to cool.

2 mins
Whisk flour, baking powder, and salt in a small bowl. Beat together butter, sugar, and vanilla to blend (mixture will be grainy).

3 mins
Beat in 1 egg. Add half of flour mixture and half of date mixture, beat to blend. Repeat with remaining egg, flour mixture, and date mixture.

40 mins
Pour batter into greased and floured baking pan. Bake for 40 minutes, or until a knife inserted in the center of the cake comes out clean.

30 mins
Let cool on a wire rack for 30 minutes.

For the sauce:
In a small saucepan, combine sugar, cream, and butter.

3 mins
Boil for 3 minutes, stirring constantly.
Remove from heat, stir in vanilla.
Allow to cool slightly, then pour generously over cake.

Recipes.name: Indiase linzencurry met maar vijf ingrediënten

Preparation.Step:
5 mins
Kook de rijst volgens de aanwijzingen op de verpakking.

10 mins
Verhit een braadpan en rooster de currymadraskruiden er kort in totdat ze beginnen te geuren. Doe er dan 600 milliliter kokend water bij en voeg het bouillonblokje toe. Doe de linzen erbij en roer goed om. Doe de deksel op de pan en kook de linzen in 20 minuten op laag vuur gaar. Roer af en toe en voeg eventueel een extra scheutje water toe als het geheel te droog wordt.

10 mins
Was de snijbonen en snijd ze in stukjes. Kook ze in 4 minuten beetgaar in water, of laat ze de laatste 5 minuten meekoken in de linzencurry.
Serveer de linzencurry en snijbonen met de rijst.

Recipes.name: Amazing Homemade Cinnamon Rolls - no mixer required

Ingredients.Name: package instant yeast or 2¼ tsp., 7 grams

Preparation.Step:
10 mins
Add milk and water in a small bowl and heat to 105 to 115 F (40 to 44 C.) Add a teaspoon of the sugar along with the yeast. Set aside for about five to 10 minutes until the mixture gets foamy/frothy. This is how you know the yeast is activated and is good.

In a medium bowl combine the flour and the salt and set aside. Then melt the butter, I usually just do it in the microwave. Add the melted butter (make sure it isn’t very hot) to the activated yeast along with the rest of your sugar. Whisk to combine.
Whisk in the egg to the yeast mixture.(If you don’t eat eggs you can leave the egg out)
Once combined we add our flour little by little, I continue to use my whisk for the first cup of flour or so, then I switch to a wooden spoon.

(You can certainly use a stand mixer to make your dough, but if you don’t have a mixer, you can do it all by hand.) Add the flour a little at a time until you get a nice tacky dough. After that knead the dough a little bit in the bowl with some extra flour, this will help get the dough off the sides of the bowl. Then pour it out onto the counter.

1 hr, 10 mins
Knead the dough for 8 to 10 minutes, using your hands or a stand mixer. Add the dough to a bowl with a bit of oil or that has been sprayed with kitchen spray. Then cover the dough with a damp cloth or plastic wrap and allow it to rise for 1 hour or until doubled. (if you have a dough proofer, this is the time to use it)

Next, roll out the dough and baste the top with softened butter. Then mix together the cinnamon, brown sugar, and vanilla extract. If you don’t have brown sugar, you can use white sugar. Sprinkle that on top of the butter, then roll up the dough tightly.

1 hr
Using dental floss* or a knife, cut about 12 rolls from the dough and place them in a 9×13 inch baking pan which has been sprayed with cooking spray. Cover with plastic wrap or a cloth and let the cinnamon rolls rise for 45 minutes to an hour.

15 mins
Remove the plastic wrap or cloth and baste the tops with butter then bake the rolls in a preheated oven (375 F/190 C) for 15 to 20 minutes until the rolls are golden brown. Once they are done allow them to cool

While the rolls are cooling make the glaze. Add the powdered sugar, melted butter, and vanilla extract, plus the milk, you can add another Tablespoon of milk if you want your glaze runnier. Then add the glaze to the top of the cinnamon rolls and they are done! Enjoy!

Recipes.name: Dark Chocolate Cherry Brownies with Ganache and Sea Salt

Ingredients.Name: fresh sweet cherries, pitted and halved
Whole sweet cherries with stems, for garnish

Preparation.Step: Preheat the oven to 350 F. Line a 9x13 baking pan with foil and spray with non-stick spray.

In a heatproof bowl set over a pan of barely simmering water, melt 8 ounces of bittersweet chocolate and all the butter, stirring occasionally until smooth. Whisk in the cocoa powder and until smooth. Set aside to cool.

5 mins
In a separate bowl, combine the eggs, sugar, vanilla bean paste and 1/2 teaspoon salt; whisk until combined, then pour in the warm chocolate mixture and whisk until smooth. Gradually add the flour, stirring with a spatula or wooden spoon just until combined. Fold in the 2 cups pitted cherries.

35 mins
Bake for 30-35 minutes, until a crust forms on top a toothpick comes out almost clean. Transfer the pan to a wire rack and let cool to room temperature, about 2 hours. Once cooled, lift the brownies by the foil out of the pan, and transfer to a cutting board.

10 mins
To make the ganache, place the remaining 8 ounces chopped bittersweet chocolate in a bowl. Pour the heavy cream into a saucepan; over medium low heat bring the cream to a gentle simmer just until it starts to bubble. Pour the hot cream over the chocolate and let stand for 5 minutes, then stir with a spatula until smooth.
Pour over the cooled brownies and smooth out the top.

Before the ganache sets, sprinkle the remaining1/2 teaspoon coarse sea salt over the ganache, then garnish with whole cherries. Let sit for 15-20 minutes until the ganache is set (you can refrigerate them to speed up the process), then cut into squares.

Ingredients.Name: boneless chicken breasts, or 1 can canned chicken
(1 can) condensed cream of chicken soup
(1 can) condensed cream of mushroom soup

Preparation.Step:
30 mins
TODO

Ingredients.Name: all purpose flour, I live in France and use T65 flour
chestnut flour, Can be replaced by cornstarch
dark chocolate, Mine has a 70% cocoa content

Preparation.Step:
5 mins
Peel and grate the zucchini. Set it aside.

10 mins
In a double boiler, melt the chocolate and butter together. This can be done in parallel with the following steps. Depending on your double boiler setting, it may take between 5 and 10 minutes. You can also melt the chocolate and butter in a microwave oven but I would not recommend it unless you know what you are doing since it is very easy to burn the chocolate this way.

2 mins
Separate the egg whites and egg yolks.

5 mins
Beat the egg yolks and the honey with an electric mixer until the mix becomes frothy and whitens.

2 mins
Add a small portion of the grated zucchini and the liquid from the grated zucchini.

5 mins
Mix the cocoa powder, all purpose flour and chestnut flour, and sift them in the egg yolks mixture. Mix until well combined. You can add a bit of grated zucchini if the batter is too stiff.

2 mins
Add the remaining grated zucchini to the batter mixture.

3 mins
Add the melted chocolate and butter, a little at a time while mixing.
Preheat your oven at 180°C

2 mins
In a separate bowl, beat the egg whites until stiff.

7 mins
Delicately incorporate the egg whites to the batter.

30 mins
Pour the batter in a sprayed / buttered mold and cook it in the oven for approximately 30 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the cake comes out clean.

5 mins
Sprinkle yeast into warm water. Stir, then let sit for 5 minutes.

1 min
Add brown sugar, salt, and stir to dissolve. Add flour, and knead untill smooth and elastic.
Let rise for 30 minutes.

2 mins
Prepare a baking soda bath with baking soda and warm water.

40 mins
Shape into pretzels, dip into water bath, and bake at 450 for 10 minutes.

5 mins
Brush with melted butter and/or sprinkle with salt

Ingredients.Name: active dry yeast, if using instant yeast, use 20 grams
flour, to mix with warm milk

Preparation.Step:
15 mins
Pour the milk into a small sauce pan. Heat the milk to 150 degrees, turn the heat to low, pour half into a measuring cup, and return the pan to the heat. Take the 40 grams of flour and whisk with the milk on the stove until it forms a white roux, then take off the heat.

20 mins
Cool the milk in the measuring cup to 100-105 degrees, then mix in the yeast. Let sit for 5-10 minutes until fully hydrated. (If using instant yeast, skip this step)

15 mins
Take the roux and add to the mixing bowl. Mix for a few minutes to cool down, then add softened butter, yeast with milk, and eggs. Mix until incorporated.
Mix the 335g of flour, salt, and sugar together.

15 mins
Wipe down the sides of the bowl and add the flour mix. Mix until well combined.

20 mins
Continue adding the 375g of flour a little at a time until the dough looks slightly moist. Turn the mixer up faster at this point to help form gluten and keep the dough from sticking too much to the sides. Periodically stop the mixer and scrape the sides and bottom. You may not need all of the flour; any leftovers can be used during shaping. You'll know it's ready when the dough passes the windowpane test.

10 mins
Cover another bowl big enough to hold the dough in oil. Remove the dough from the mixing bowl, wash it, and cover the bowl with oil. Remove the dough from the temporary bowl, shape into a ball, and plop it into the oiled mixing bowl.

45 mins
Spray plastic wrap and cover the dough, then put in the oven to proof for 45 minutes or until it doubles in volume.

20 mins
Punch the dough down and let sit for another 15-20 minutes until risen. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees.

15 mins
Roll the dough into a log on floured surface, then cut into 40 gram sections, placing the dough balls onto the baking sheet.

15 mins
Bake for 12-14 minutes until golden brown. Top the finished rolls with melted butter while still hot.

Ingredients.Name: xaoxing wine, or xeres, mirin, white whine, even marsala could do
ground pepper, freshly ground if possible

Preparation.Step:
5 mins
Prepare the sauce. Peel and chop the garlic cloves and mix with the rest of the ingredients. Set aside.

15 mins
Prepare the shrimps (optional). With a pair of scissors, remove the whiskers and legs, and slightly trim the tail. With a knife, slice the back of the shrimp and remove the vein (do not slice in half, just run your knife until you can get the vein out). Also slightly slice the belly of the shrimp, so that the shrimp can absorb more sauce while cooking. Then rinse the shrimps and dry them well with some paper towel.
Note : If you are too lazy to properly deal with the shrimp, at least make sure they are clean and dry them with paper towel to facilitate the pan frying stage.

1 min
Cut the ginger into slices of 2 to 3 mm thick.

3 mins
Heat a frying pan with a good centimeter or more of olive oil on high heat.

2 mins
Put the ginger in and fry it until almost dry (it should look dry and be less bubbly).

2 mins
At this stage, the oil should be pretty hot. If it is not, wait for a couple of minutes. Then add the shrimps and fry them until cooked (the shell will have small brown spots, the shrimps will be uniformly pink and well coiled).

2 mins
Add the sauce mix and reduce the heat to medium. Cook a few more minutes until the sauce thickens and coats the shrimps.
Add coriander and serve.

2 mins
Mix together shortening, flour, and molasses in a stand mixer until thoroughly combined.

5 mins
Stir in flour, soda, salt, and water a little bit at a time while the mixer is on low. Scrape the sides to ensure everything is combined.

1 min
Fold in allspice, ginger, cinnamon, and cloves, and mix until combined. Try not to overwork the dough.

30 mins
Chill dough for 30 mins.

2 mins
Heavily flour a large work surface, rolling pin, and your hands. Roll out dough to ~ 1/2" thickness.

10 mins
Cut with your favorite cookie cutter, and place on a greased baking sheet.

15 mins
Bake for approx. 15 mins, or until no imprint remains when lightly touched.
While cookies are cooling, combine powdered sugar, lemon juice, and lemon zest in a large mixing bowl.

optional
Separate portions of icing into smaller bowls, and mix in food coloring to create different colored icing.

1 hr
Once cookies are cooled, liberally glaze cookies with your icing. Allow to set for 1 hour before eating.

Ingredients.Name: Packet Super Wine Biscuits, Arrowroot a good alternative

Preparation.Step:
1 sec
Crush biscuits into a fine crumb in the food processor, add melted butter and blend well.
Pour into a 22cm springform tin and press down well – for a thinner crust you can press it up the side of the tin or pat it down into one layer.
Pop this in the fridge while you prepare the filling.
Rinse out the food processor or use a food mixer
Combine together cream cheese, vanilla and sugar until it is light and fluffy – scraping down the sides occasionally.
You really want the mixture to be creamy and satiny to ensure you get the best texture in the end so whip a minute longer than you think you need to.

15 mins
In a small bowl, break the chocolate into pieces and melt in the microwave – heating for 10-15 second bursts, stirring in between until completely melted and smooth
Fold the thickened cream and chocolate gently into the cream cheese mixture until well combined – I used the food processor and just put it on lowest speed until just combined.
Pour the cream cheese mixture onto the biscuit base and gently smooth it using a knife.

4 hrs
Refrigerate until set – ideally 4 hours, but can also be made a day ahead if required.

20 mins
Once set, remove from the fridge for 20 minutes.
Use a slightly warm knife around the edge and gently undo the spring from tin, then carefully transfer to a serving plate and remove the base of the tin.
Ideally allow to reach room temperature before serving.
You can serve it as is, or add some caramel topping, grated chocolate or even a ganache.

5 mins
Mix together 3 parts Oak, 2 parts Pecan, and 1 part Hickory.
Mix together melted butter, sugars, molasses, and eggs. Set aside.
In another bowl, mix together the flour, spices, salt, and soda. Stir dry ingredients with wet ingredients. Dough will be soft and sticky.

2 hrs
Chill dough for ease in forming the cookies.
Preheat oven to 350 F.
Make small balls of dough (2-3 tablespoons each) and roll in a bowl of white sugar to coat.
Place on a cookie sheet. Do not flatten.

20 mins
Bake until top is soft and starting to crack, approx. 10-12 minutes.

Ingredients.Name: berries and powdered sugar as garnish optional

Preparation.Step: Preheat your oven to 350°F. Grease a 10" pan or line it with parchment paper.

2 mins
Combine the white chocolate and milk / cream in a microwave safe bowl. Heat in 30 second increments and stir after every 30 seconds. Set aside to cool while you prepare the rest. Beat the butter with 100 grams of sugar and beat until fluffy.

5 mins
Add the lemon zest, egg yolks, and lemon extract, and beat until well combined. Then add the almond flour and the melted chocolate. Add the limoncello / lemon juice and beat until combined.

10 mins
In a separate bowl (with clean beaters), beat the egg whites until soft peaks form. Gradually add the remaining 30 grams of sugar to the egg white mixture. Fold the egg whites into the almond batter until well combined.

45 mins
Spoon the batter into the greased pan and bake for 40 - 45 minutes.

Let it cool completely in the pan and then invert the cake onto a plate, and then flip that back into the pan or onto another plate (so that it's not upside down). Sprinkle on some powdered sugar if desired and top with berries, but only just before serving.

3 mins
Cream butter, peanut butter, and sugars together in a bowl; beat in eggs.

1 hr, 5 mins
In a separate bowl, sift flour, baking powder, baking soda, and table salt; stir into butter mixture. Put dough in refrigerator for 1 hour.

22 mins
Roll dough into 1 inch balls and put on baking sheets. Flatten each ball with a fork, making a crisscross pattern. Sprinkle with kosher salt. Bake in a preheated 325 degrees F oven for about 10-14 minutes or until cookies begin to brown.

8 mins
Hit the “Saute” button on Instant Pot and heat the oil. Add the onions, carrots, and celery. Saute, stirring occasionally, until tender, about 5 minutes.

2 mins
Add the garlic, cumin, turmeric, thyme, 1 teaspoon salt, and 1/4 teaspoon pepper and cook, stirring constantly, for one minute. Add the lentils and pour in the broth. Stir.

20 mins
Place the lid on the Instant Pot and make sure the release valve is in the “sealing” position. Select "Pressure Cook" and set the timer at 12 minutes.

2 mins
Release the valve immediately then remove the lid of the Instant Pot. Stir in the spinach. Taste and add additional salt and pepper if desired. Serve.

10 mins
Mix all ingredients (except toppings) and separate into individual jars. Leave in fridge overnight.

10 mins
Take the quartered potatoes and simmer them in salted water until they’re fully cooked through.

30 mins
Then while they’re still warm quarter them and after they’re all quartered, and still warm ish- put them in a full pan and give it a quick shake back and forth a couple times so the outside of the spuds get a bit of that almost but not quite crumbly look. Then let them cool and fry to order after.

15 mins
Fry in bacon fat or whatever till they look good.

1 hr
optional
Alternately, you can bake at 450 for 20 minutes, toss them, then continue to bake and toss for 30-40 more minutes, until golden.

1 min
optional
Then just toss em with whatever- Parmesan and thyme, caramelized onion and Cajun spice and clarified butter. Good to go.

20 mins
Mix together like regular bread dough and let it rise for
15 minutes then roll or press it out to size.

Add pizza sauce then a layer of Mozzarella cheese
then add your toppings and another layer of cheese.
Now put on your final topping.

12 mins
Bake at 450 degrees until pizza crust is golden brown
on the edges and the cheese starts to bubble and get
some color also... cool a bit and cut with a pizza cutter!

Ingredients.Name: tomato sauce, or one 14.5 oz can
up to 2 teaspoons liquid smoke, optional, but nice if you’re wanting the smokey flavor optional
cayenne pepper, optional– use only if you want a kick

Preparation.Step:
10 mins
Combine all ingredients in a medium saucepan, and bring to a simmer over medium heat.

15 mins
Continue to mix and simmer for 10-15 minutes so all the ingredients can meld together.
Transfer to a jar and store in the refrigerator for up to several weeks. You can also freeze it for longer storage.
In 1-quart canning jar, mix together the vinegar, water, salt, bay leaves, onion and cloves.

1 wk
Place hard-cooked eggs in jar. Place jar in refrigerator to ferment one week.
Preheat oven to 350°F.

optional
Zest 1 lemon (should yield ~1 tsp zest), and juice them both. If not using whole lemons, sub 7 tbsp lemon juice instead.

2 mins
Cream flour, butter, and powdered sugar together and press into an ungreased 9"x12" baking pan.

20 mins
Bake for 20 minutes.

3 mins
Beat eggs together. Add lemon juice, lemon zest (if using), sugar, flour, and salt, and beat together until combined.

25 mins
Pour mixture on the baked crust, and bake for 25 minutes.
Sprinkle with powdered sugar while still warm.

Ingredients.Name: butternut squash, peeled, seeded, and cut into 1-inch cubes
carrot, peeled and cut into 1-inch chunks
medium cloves garlic, unpeeled but separated
Anaheim pepper, deseeded and finely diced
vegetable stock, plus more as needed
Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper

Preparation.Step:
45 mins
Preheat oven to 425°F (230°C). Toss squash, potato, and carrot with oil and arrange on 2 rimmed baking sheets, being sure not to overcrowd the sheets. Make a foil packet for the garlic cloves, add oil, and close up. Roast everything for 20 minutes, then remove garlic packet. Continue roasting everything else until very well browned on a couple of sides, about 40 minutes; use a spatula to turn 2 or 3 times during cooking. Set aside.

10 mins
In a large dutch oven or stock pot, cook butter over medium-high heat until just starting to brown. Add onion and garlic, lower heat to medium, and cook, stirring, until soft and lightly golden, about 10 minutes; lower heat as necessary to prevent burning.

20 mins
Add squash, potato, and carrot to saucepan and remove from heat. Pour 1/2 cup (120ml) stock into each baking sheet and scrape up any browned bits, then pour into saucepan. Squeeze garlic cloves out from their paper and into the soup. Add remaining stock, rosemary, thyme, and bay leaf and return to medium-high heat. Bring to a simmer, then lower heat and simmer until vegetables are very soft, about 10 minutes. Discard thyme sprigs and bay leaf.

15 mins
Using a high-powered blender, standard countertop blender or immersion blender, blend soup until completely smooth. Season with salt and pepper. Return soup to saucepan and thin, if necessary, with additional stock until desired consistency is reached. Keep warm.
Ladle soup into warmed bowls and top with sour cream and nutmeg if using. Serve right away.

10 mins
Preheat an oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).

Stir together the flour, sugar, and salt in a 9 inch pie pan, and make a well in the center. Pour the oil and rice milk into the well, then mix with a fork until a dough forms. Use your hands to press the mixture evenly into the bottom and sides of the pan. Crimp the edge of the crust.

15 mins
Stir together the white sugar, brown sugar, cinnamon, salt, ginger, nutmeg, and cloves in a large bowl; set aside. Whisk together the pumpkin puree, oil, eggs, vanilla, and rice milk in a separate bowl until evenly blended. Add the pumpkin mixture to the dry ingredients and stir until fully blended. Pour into the prepared crust and place on a cookie sheet in the preheated oven.

1 hr
Bake for 10 minutes. Reduce temperature to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) and bake for 40 to 50 minutes or until a knife inserted near the center comes out clean. The center may still wiggle a little but will firm up out of the oven. Cool on a metal rack.

Ingredients.Name: Sugar, May Sub Date / Coconut Nectar

Preparation.Step:
5 mins
Add 1 tablespoon olive oil to the wok and set heat to high. When oil is smoking, add beans and cook, stirring and tossing occasionally, until blistered and tender, about 3 minutes. Transfer to bowl with tofu.

5 mins
Add remaining tablespoon of olive oil to wok and return to high heat until lightly smoking. Add curry paste all at once and cook, stirring continuously, until aromatic and sizzling, about 1 minute.

5 mins
Return tofu and beans to pan, along with sugar and soy sauce. Stir and toss to combine and coat tofu and beans in curry paste. Season to taste with more salt if desired. Serve immediately over rice.

Ingredients.Name: canned black beans, rinsed and drained

Preparation.Step: If grilling, preheat an outdoor grill for high heat, and lightly oil a sheet of aluminum foil. If baking, preheat oven to 375 degrees F, and lightly oil a baking sheet.

1 min
In a medium bowl, mash black beans until thick and pasty.

5 mins
In a food processor, finely chop bell pepper, jalapeno pepper, onion, and garlic. If you don't have a food processor, dice it all. Then stir into mashed beans.

2 mins
In a small bowl, stir together egg, chili powder, cumin, and chili sauce.

5 mins
Stir the egg mixture into the mashed beans. Mix in bread crumbs until the mixture is sticky and holds together. Might need more breadcrumbs. Divide mixture into four patties.

24 mins
If grilling, place patties on foil, and grill about 8 minutes on each side. If baking, place patties on baking sheet, and bake about 14 minutes on each side, until not soft and mushy.

Ingredients.Name: powdered mustard, regular mustard will work if you don't have powdered
medium yellow or white onion, diced
shredded cheese, I like cheddar. Store-brand is great because there are already so many other flavors. I do fancy cheddar for guests.

Preparation.Step: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.

8 mins
In a large pot of boiling, salted water cook the pasta to VERY al dente. Really, half cook it.

15 mins
While the pasta is cooking, in a separate pot, melt the butter. Whisk in the flour and mustard and keep it moving for about five minutes. Make sure it's free of lumps. Stir in the milk, onion, bay leaf, paprika, and hot sauce. Simmer for ten minutes and remove the bay leaf.

5 mins
Temper in the egg. Stir in 3/4 of the cheese. Season with salt and pepper. Fold the macaroni into the mix and pour into a 2-quart casserole dish. Top with remaining cheese.

35 mins
Melt the butter in a saute pan and mix the bread crumbs to get a sandy consistency. Top the macaroni with the bread crumbs. Bake for 30 minutes. Remove from oven and rest for five minutes before serving.
Fudge Baking Instructions:
Bring sugar, butter, and milk to full roaring boil, stirring constantly.

5 mins
Boil for 5 minutes at medium heat, stirring constantly.
Remove from heat between 235-240 degrees Fahrenheit.
Stir in chocolate chips until melted.
Stir in marshmallow creme and vanilla and beat until fluffy and smooth.
Pour into greased 9x13" pan and cool at room temperature.
Pumpkin Topping Instructions:

1 min
Melt the white chocolate chips in the microwave for about 1 minute
Fully stir in the pumpkin puree, pumpkin spice, and vanilla extract.
Put topping on top of fudge (recommended to be done after fudge has cooled for a bit)

5 mins
In a mixing bowl, cream butter and sugar. Add eggs, mix well.

5 mins
Combine dry ingredients and stir into creamed mixture until just moistened.

5 mins
Stir in pumpkin.

1 hr
Pour into two greased 9x5x3 loaf pans. Bake at 350F for 1 hour or until bread tests done. Cool in pan 10 minutes before serving.

Recipes.name: Polenta Cornbread made with Creamed Corn

Preparation.Step:
5 mins
Preheat oven to 425°F. Grease a 10" cast iron skillet or medium baking dish.

1 hr
In a small bowl, combine the polenta and creamed corn. Let soak for at least an hour.

15 mins
In a large mixing bowl combine flour, baking powder, and salt. In a separate bowl, whisk the eggs, melted butter, and honey. Add eggs to soaked polenta, then add to the dry ingredients and stir until just incorporated.

20 mins
Pour the batter into the prepared skillet and smooth the top. Bake until cornbread is golden yellow, about 17 to 21 minutes. (I like to pull it out on the early side so that it doesn't overcook or dry out.) Remove from the oven and cool completely. Serve with extra butter and hot soup.

Ingredients.Name: brussels sprouts, trimmed of outer leaves and sliced in half

Preparation.Step:
30 mins
Preheat oven to 400°F. Spray an 8"x12" gratin dish or casserole with olive oil. Add the brussels sprouts and season with salt and pepper. Spray more olive oil over the brussels and place in the lower third of the oven. Bake 15 minutes, toss and bake an additional 10 minutes.

15 mins
Meanwhile, heat a medium nonstick pan over medium heat. Add butter and let it melt, add the shallots and cook until softened, about 4 to 5 minutes. Sprinkle the flour over the shallots to make a roux, whisking for 1 to 2 minutes. Add the milk and stir with a wooden spoon until the roux is incorporated into the milk. Cook over medium-low heat for about 4 minutes, stirring, until the sauce thickens. Add fresh thyme, parmesan and half of the grated Gruyere cheese into the white sauce and stir until the cheese is melted and incorporated into the sauce.

20 mins
Pour over the brussels sprouts, and top with the remaining cheese. Bake for 15 minutes until top is lightly browned and bubbly.

Ingredients.Name: roomkaas met kruiden, hoeveelheid naar eigen inschatting ;)

Preparation.Step:
3 mins
Zet een pan water op en kook de pasta volgens de bereidingswijze op het pak.

5 mins
Snijd de ui, courgette en de cherrytomaatjes (plus eventueel ontbijtspek/zalm) in stukjes.

5 mins
Giet een klein scheutje olie in een pan en bak alles aan.

5 mins
Voeg na circa 5 minuten de spinazie toe en bak dit een paar minuten mee. Als je verse spinazie gebruikt, dan moet de spinazie eerst slinken voordat je de roomkaas erbij doet. Als je diepvriesspinazie gebruikt, dan verwarm je die 2-3 minuten mee.

5 mins
Voeg vervolgens de roomkaas, cherrytomaatjes en kookroom toe en laat de roomkaas smelten. Breng het geheel op smaak met zout en peper.

2 mins
Meng de pasta door de saus en smullen maar.

Ingredients.Name: avocado, halved, seeded, peeled, and sliced

Preparation.Step:
5 mins
Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium high heat. Add garlic and jalapeno, and cook, stirring frequently, until fragrant, about 1 minute.

25 mins
Stir in quinoa, vegetable broth, beans, tomatoes, corn, chili powder and cumin; season with salt and pepper, to taste. Bring to a boil; cover, reduce heat and simmer until quinoa is cooked through, about 20 minutes. Stir in avocado, lime juice and cilantro.

1 min
Cream together butter and sugar.
Beat in egg.
Add vanilla, salt, and flour. Mix until just incorporated.
Wrap air-tight in cling wrap. Refrigerate until firm, about 1 hour.

Roll to 1/4 inch thick, cut shapes, and freeze until stiff and completely unbendable. Like you could stand it up on an edge and there'd be zero flop, and it you tried too hard to bend it the cookie would snap. It takes a couple hours to freeze thoroughly.
Bake at 325 degrees F for 10-25 minutes, until edges are very slightly golden.

Ingredients.Name: unsweetened cocoa powder, preferably Dutch process

Preparation.Step:
10 mins
Preheat oven to 350F
Spray an 8"x4" pan with non-stick cooking spray. Line with parchment paper. Spray the paper.
Mix flour, baking powder, and salt in a medium bowl. In a separate bowl, combine the melted butter with the cocoa and blend until smooth.

Using a food processor, mix the softened butter with the sugar in a big bowl. When combined, add eggs and vanilla and continue to process until creamy. Add the dry ingredients and pulse until JUST combined. Finally, add cream/milk and process until smooth. Add 1 cup of this batter to the bowl with the cocoa and stir until smooth.

Pour half of the remaining batter into the prepared pan and smooth the surface with the back of a spoon. Spread the chocolate batter in the pan and then top with the rest of the batter. Using a butter knife, decoratively cut 5 swirls in the batter.

1 hr, 10 mins
Bake for 25 minutes at 350F. Reduce temperature to 325F and bake for an additional 25 minutes. Loosely cover with foil and bake 15 to 20 minutes longer, or until top is lightly browned and a toothpick inserted into the center comes out with moist crumbs attached. Let cool in pan 10 minutes before removing. Let cool completely on a wire rack. Dust with confectioners' sugar before serving.

1 hr, 15 mins
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).

In a medium bowl, cream together butter and white sugar until smooth. Mix in 1/2 teaspoon almond extract. Mix in flour until dough comes together. Roll dough into 1 1/2 inch balls, and place on ungreased cookie sheets. Make a small hole in the center of each ball, using your thumb and finger, and fill the hole with preserves.
Bake for 14 to 18 minutes in preheated oven, or until lightly browned. Let cool 1 minute on the cookie sheet.
In a medium bowl, mix together the confectioners' sugar, 3/4 teaspoon almond extract, and milk until smooth. Drizzle lightly over warm cookies.

Ingredients.Name: brandy-based orange liqueur, such as Grand Marnier® (Can be replaced with lemon juice) optional

Preparation.Step:
1 hr, 40 mins
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Lightly grease 2 loaf pans.

Sift together the flour, baking powder, ground ginger, and salt in a bowl; set aside. Cream together the butter and 2 cups sugar in a separate large bowl; beat in the eggs. Stir in the lemon zest and orange liqueur. Add the buttermilk. Add the flour mixture while whisking gently. Pour the mixture into the prepared loaf pans.
Bake in the preheated ovens until a toothpick or small knife inserted in the crown comes out clean, about 50 minutes. Remove from pans and move to a cooling rack.
Whisk together the lemon juice and 3/4 cup sugar until the sugar dissolves. Gently drizzle the mixture over the hot loaves. Allow the loaves to cool completely before serving.

5 mins
Schil de aardappelen en snijd in 4 gelijke stukken.

20 mins
Kook de aardappelen samen met de boerenkool in ruim water met zout in 20 min. gaar.

5 mins
Verwarm de rookworst volgens de aanwijzingen op de verpakking. Zorg dat de rookworst ongeveer tegelijk klaar is met de rest van het recept, zodat de worst lekker warm geserveerd wordt!

5 mins
Verwarm de melk en de boter in een steelpan.

5 mins
Schenk de warme melk en boter bij de aardappelen en boerenkool en stamp met de pureestamper tot een grove puree. Breng op smaak met de honingmosterd, peper en zout.

5 mins
Verdeel de stamppot over borden en serveer met de rookworst.

optional
variatietip: Je kunt de stamppot extra smaak en stevigheid geven door er 100 g geraspte oude kaas doorheen te mengen.

Recipes.name: Chinese Smashed Cucumbers With Sesame Oil and Garlic

Ingredients.Name: thin-skinned cucumbers like English or Persian, (8 to 10 mini cucumbers, 4 medium-size or 2 large greenhouse)
kosher salt, plus more for cucumbers
granulated sugar, plus more for cucumbers
flavorless vegetable oil, uch as plain olive oil or, better yet, peanut oil.
large garlic cloves, minced or put through a press
Small handful whole cilantro leaves, for garnish
toasted white sesame seeds, for garnish optional
Lao Chen cu (aged Shanxi dark vinegar), instead of rice vinegar (see note) optional

Preparation.Step:
40 mins
Rinse cucumbers and pat dry. Cut crosswise into pieces about 4 inches long. Cut each piece in half lengthwise.

On a work surface, place a piece of cucumber (or several) cut side down. Lay the blade of a large knife flat on top the cucumber and smash down lightly with your other hand. The skin will begin to crack, the flesh will break down and the seeds will separate. Repeat until the whole piece is smashed. Break or slice diagonally into bite-size pieces, leaving the seeds behind.

Place the cucumber pieces in a strainer and toss with a big pinch of salt and a big pinch of sugar. Place a plastic bag filled with ice on top of the cucumbers to serve as a weight and place the strainer over a bowl. Let drain 15 to 30 minutes on the counter, or in the refrigerator until ready to serve, up to 4 hours.
Make the dressing: In a small bowl, combine salt, sugar and rice vinegar. Stir until salt and sugar are dissolved. Stir in sesame oil and soy sauce.

When ready to serve, shake cucumbers well to drain off any remaining liquid and transfer to a serving bowl. Drizzle with grapeseed or olive oil and toss. Add half the dressing, half the garlic and the red pepper flakes to taste, and toss. Keep adding dressing until cucumbers are well coated but not drowned. Taste and add more pepper flakes and garlic if needed. Serve immediately, garnished with cilantro and sesame seeds.

5 mins
Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat, until shimmering. Add shallots and saute 2 minutes; then add garlic and saute an additional 1 minute.

5 mins
Add the lemon juice and cook for 30 seconds to temper the acidity, and then add the wine, deglazing the bottom of the pan. Bring to a boil and reduce (if you drag a spoon through the sauce and it doesn't immediately fill back in, you're good).

1 min
Add cream and stir to combine, bring back to a boil.

4 mins
Take the skillet off the heat, and add butter 1 piece at a time. Whisk vigorously until fully incorporated.
Season to taste.
Preheat oven to 350°F.

20 mins
Saute onion, then mushrooms and garlic until liquid boils off.

10 mins
Cut squash in half lengthwise, then scoop innards out.

30 mins
Mix everything else together, fill squash, and bake until done.

Ingredients.Name: boneless skinless chicken thighs, cut into 3/4-inch chunks (see note)
homemade or store-bought low-sodium chicken stock
vegetable oil, peanut- or canola oil, divided
large red bell pepper, cut into 3/4-inch dice
large green bell pepper, cut into 3/4-inch dice
minced fresh garlic, about 2 medium cloves
scallion, white and light green parts only, finely minced
small dried red Chinese or Arbol chilies, see note

Preparation.Step:
30 mins
For the Chicken: Combine chicken, salt, pepper, soy sauce, wine, sugar, sesame oil, and cornstarch in a medium bowl and toss to coat. Set aside for 20 minutes.
For the Stir-Fry: Combine soy sauce, wine, vinegar, chicken stock, sugar, sesame oil, and cornstarch in a small bowl and whisk together until homogenous. Set aside.

Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a wok over high heat until smoking. Add chicken, spread into a single layer, and cook without moving until lightly browned, about 1 minute. Continue cooking, tossing and stirring frequently, until the exterior is opaque but chicken is still slightly raw in the center, about 2 minute longer. Transfer to a clean bowl and set aside.

Wipe out wok and heat remaining 2 tablespoons oil over high heat until smoking. Add bell peppers and celery and cook, stirring and tossing occasionally, until brightly colored and browned in spots, about 1 minute. Add peanuts and toss to combine.

Push vegetables up side of wok to clear a space in the center. Add garlic, ginger, scallions, and dried chilies and cook, stirring, until fragrant, about 30 seconds. Return chicken to wok and toss to combine. Stir sauce and add to wok. Cook, tossing, until sauce thickens and coats ingredients and chicken is cooked through, about 1 minute longer. Serve immediately.
Peel apples
Cut apples in half and core them
Quarter the apples
Put the water, sugar, and cinnamon in a pot with the apples

10 mins
Bring to boiling, then simmer for 8-10 mins. stirring
When soft, stab at apples with a fork
Mash the apples and serve.

1 min
Take a baking tray out of the oven and preheat that oven at 175 degrees Celsius (345 degrees Fahrenheit)

4 mins
Mix all the dry ingredients (self-raising flower, sugar, speculaaskruiden and salt)

5 mins
Add the butter and milk and knead everything into one firm ball by hand.

15 mins
Create small balls out of this dough, about the size of a marble. Push them down on the tray a bit so they'll have a flat bottom. (This mixture should give you about 70 balls.)

25 mins
when your tray is full, put it in the pre-heated oven for 25 minutes.
After they've cooled down a bit, start eating! Enjoy :)

10 mins
Put all the ingredients together and stir well. Store your spice blend in an airtight container for up to six months.

optional
There may be some spices you can only find whole. To turn them into a powder, dry roast them in a hot pan until they start to release their aroma. Then transfer them to a mortar and pestle and grind the spices to a fine powder.

5 mins
Mix!

2 mins
Place the quinoa in fine sieve or strainer and rinse thoroughly under cool running water and allow to drain.
Position a rack in the middle of the oven and heat to 177C

10 mins
Bring the quinoa, chicken stock and 2 teaspoons of the salt to a boil in a medium saucepan over high heat.

15 mins
Reduce the heat to low, stir, cover and cook for 15 minutes. When 5 minutes remain, add the broccoli right on top of the quinoa and replace the lid.

5 mins
Heat a large, straight-sided saute pan over high heat and add the mushrooms and 1/3 cup of water. Cook until the mushrooms collapse, 2 to 3 minutes, then add 2 tablespoons of the butter and cook until browned. Remove to a large bowl.

5 mins
Add the remaining 2 tablespoons of butter to the pan along with the onions and the remaining teaspoon of salt. Reduce the heat to low and sweat the onions until translucent, about 5 minutes. Then stir in the mustard, smoked paprika, black pepper, cayenne and white pepper and cook for 1 minute more. Add the half-and-half to the pan and heat until warm.

5 mins
Whisk the egg in a medium bowl and temper with 1 cup of the hot liquid, continuing to whisk to prevent curdling. Then whisk the egg mixture back into the saute pan and add the cheese, stirring until melted.
Add the quinoa, broccoli, mayonnaise and the melted cheese mixture to the bowl with the mushrooms and stir to combine.

45 mins
Pour the quinoa mixture into an ungreased 9-by-13-inch glass baking dish (see Cook's Note). Bake until set and just beginning to brown, about 45 minutes or until the internal temperature reaches 96-99C.

10 mins
Cool 10 minutes before serving.

Ingredients.Name: gochugaru, or crushed red pepper flakes
hangar steak, or boneless short rib

Preparation.Step:
2 mins
Add pear, garlic, soy sauce, gochugaru, ginger, brown sugar, and sesame oil to a food processor, and pulse until everything is roughly combined.
Add mixture to a ziplock bag and set aside.

10 mins
Trim excess fat off of the meat, and slice thinly perpendicular to the grain of the meat.

2 hrs
Add meat slices to bag, mix thoroughly, and refrigerate for 2 - 8 hours.
Remove meat from bag and pat dry with a paper towel.

7 mins
Heat large skillet with half of coconut oil over medium-high heat. Add half of the meat strips, and cook until browned and the edges are crispy.

7 mins
Remove meat from skillet and add a quick sprinkle of salt and pepper while still hot. Repeat previous step with remainder of meat.

10 mins
While cooking the beef, saute onion strips over medium heat (in a separate pan) until soft and golden.
Plate beef and onions with sliced scallions and sesame seeds for garnish.
Start by setting a medium pot of water over high heat until boiling.

2 mins
Separate english muffin halves and toast.

2 mins
Melt butter in a saucepan over low heat.

2 mins
Heat up your sausage patties according to product instructions.

6 mins
Once the water is boiling, gently drop each egg into the water. Poach for 3 minutes (I usually do 2 eggs at a time).

1 min
Add egg yolks, lemon juice, cayenne, and dill weed to the blender, and blend for 20 seconds, until mixture starts to come together.

2 mins
While still blending, slowly stream in melted butter, and blend for an additional minute, or until sauce is thickened. Season sauce to taste.

2 mins
Assemble with 1 toasted english muffin half, sausage patty, poached egg, and hollandaise sauce.

Ingredients.Name: salt and white pepper, to taste

Preparation.Step: Preheat oven to 350°F

10 mins
Saute the sausage until brown and break it up into bite size pieces. Set aside.

10 mins
Saute mushrooms and garlic until soft. Season to taste, erring on the salty side. Add to the bowl with the sausage.

5 mins
Whisk eggs and milk until well combined.

30 mins
Spray pie pan. Add sausage, then mushrooms, then cheese, then pour eggs on top. Bake until just set.

20 mins
Peel and chop the carrots and potatoes into ~1 inch pieces. Chop the cod, salmon, shrimp, and smoked salmon into bite-sized pieces. Cook the mussels until they open and de-shell them.

4 mins
Add olive oil to large stock pot over medium heat until shimmering. Add carrots and potatoes and sweat for 3-4 minutes.

5 mins
Turn the heat to medium-high, add wine, and simmer until wine is reduced by half.

5 mins
Add the stock and bring back to a boil.

30 mins
Add the cod, salmon, shrimp, scallops, mussels, and dill to the pot. Reduce heat and simmer for 30 minutes.
Remove pot from heat, and stir in the lemon juice, and then the heavy cream. Season to taste with salt and pepper.

Ingredients.Name: Russet potatoes, peeled and cut into 1 inch pieces (3 lbs.)
bulb of garlic, top cut off

Preparation.Step: Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).

20 mins
Place potatoes in a shallow roasting pan and drizzle with 1 tablespoon olive oil. Sprinkle with pepper; stir to coat. Place pepper in another shallow roasting pan and drizzle with 1 tablespoon olive oil; stir to coat. Wrap the garlic in foil and drizzle with 2 tablespoons olive oil.

25 mins
Bake everything for 10 minutes, then remove the garlic. Continue baking potatoes and peppers for 15 minutes, or until potatoes are browned. Reserve peppers.

30 mins
In a 3 quart saucepan heat remaining oil; saute onions for 5 minutes. Add potatoes, fake bacon bits, and garlic and stir in broth and water. Bring to a boil, reduce heat and simmer, uncovered, for 20 minutes.

15 mins
Reserve 1/3 of potatoes and use immersion blender on the rest. Return reserved potatoes and peppers to the pot. Stir in milk and season with green onions and salt to taste. Ladle into bowls and top with reserved roasted potatoes.
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees.

15 mins
Lightly salt the eggplant slices and allow to stand for 15 minutes. Pat the slices dry and set aside.

5 mins
Heat a thin layer of olive oil in a large skillet. Pan fry the eggplant in batches over medium-high heat until golden brown on both sides, about 2 minutes per side. Add more oil as necessary between batches so the eggplant doesn't burn, but try not to have too heavy a hand - the pan just needs to be greased. Remove the eggplant to a plate.

10 mins
Add the onion to the skillet and saute over medium heat until soft, 3 minutes. Add the garlic, chili flakes, 1/2 teaspoon sea salt and cinnamon. Cook for one minute more, until fragrant. Carefully pour in the tomatoes and simmer until thickened slightly, 5 minutes. Remove from the heat and stir in half the parsley.

5 mins
Add 1/4 cup of sauce to the bottom of an oven-safe dish or skillet. Arrange one layer of eggplant evenly in the bottom of the skillet or dish. Slather with a layer of sauce, and repeat with the remaining eggplant and sauce - like you would a lasagna.

55 mins
Cover with foil and bake in the oven for 45 minutes, until the eggplant is very soft and the sauce has reduced. Allow to sit for 10 minutes before cutting into it. Garnish with the remaining parsley and serve warm or at room temperature.
Toss the popcorn and cashews together in a very large, heat-proof mixing bowl. Spray two half sheet pans with non-stick cooking spray or line with silpats.
Preheat the oven to 250°F.

10 mins
In a large saucepan combine the brown sugar, butter, dark maple syrup, vanilla, and kosher salt over medium heat. Stir until the butter is melted. Bring to a boil. If using the bourbon, add it when the mixture reaches a boil. Boil for 5 minutes, remove from the heat, and stir in the baking soda. It will foam up and expand. When the baking soda is fully dissolved and the caramel is foamed up, pour it over the popcorn and cashews in the mixing bowl and gently toss until everything is evenly coated.

1 hr
Divide between the two half sheet pans and bake for 1 hour, stirring and rotating pans every 15 minutes.

Let the caramel corn cool on the silpats (or gently transfer into a heat-proof mixing bowl to cool if using sprayed pans.) This caramel corn is good for a week or so in a tightly lidded container at room temperature.
First, preheat oven to 375ºF. Then spray a baking sheet with nonstick cooking spray or line with parchment paper. Set aside.

5 mins
In a large bowl, mix together maple syrup, coconut sugar, and sea salt. Then, add in cashews sesame seeds and mix so that everything is evenly coated.
Transfer cashews onto baking sheet. Spread out evenly.

10 mins
Roast at 375ºF for 10 minutes or until cashews begin to turn golden brown. Then remove from oven and let sit for 10 minutes (they will get crunchy!).

10 mins
Sift the cocoa, sugar, flour, and salt into a large skillet, preferably a cast iron skillet. Add the milk in a slow, steady stream, whisking until smooth.

20 mins
Cook over medium heat, stirring continuously with a heatproof spatula or wooden spoon, until the gravy thickens to the consistency of thin pudding, about 20 minutes. The gravy will thicken around the edge first, so make sure to keep it stirred up from the bottom and sides.
If traveling, stop and refrigerate here. Take to your destination, then finish.

5 mins
Remove the skillet from the heat and drop in the butter. Stir until melted and smooth. Serve the warm gravy with the biscuits.

5 mins
Rinse sushi rice in fine mesh strainer until water runs clear.

13 mins
Add sushi rice and water to Instant Pot. Set to cook for 7 minutes, with a 5 minute natural release.

10 mins
The Instant Pot will take around 10 minutes to get up to pressure.

10 mins
Place spam slices in medium skillet over medium-high heat (no oil is necessary). Cook spams until heated through and some crispy parts have formed.
Optionally, add some water to the skillet to help render out fat from the spam.

2 mins
Combine rice seasoning ingredients in a small bowl, and whisk together until sugar and salt is dissolved in the vinegar. Once rice is finished cooking, release pressure and add seasoning to rice; stir to combine.

1 min
Using the short side of a slice of spam as a guide, cut the nori into strips.

1 min
Wet your hands so the rice doesn't stick to them, and grab a small handful of rice. Cup your palm and press it down, so that it is 2-3 fingers wide.

2 mins
Place rice ball onto single nori strip. Optionally brush spam with teriyaki sauce, and place spam on top of rice. Fold nori around the spam and rice, sealing with a few individual grains of rice.

15 mins
Repeat until all spam, rice, and nori is used.

10 mins
