Cream together butter and sugar. Add salt, eggs and vanilla. Slowly add the flour until combined.

4 hrs
Refrigerate for 4 hours.

30 mins
Break off sections and roll out in flour about 1/4” thick. Cut out using favorite cookie cutters!

10 mins
Bake at 350° for 8-10 mins.

15 mins
optional
Decorate with royal icing or favorite frosting.

Recipes.name: KETO CHICKEN BURGERS – ZUCCHINI AND HALLOUMI

Preparation.Step:
5 mins
1.) Grate zucchini and halloumi and place into a large bowl.

3 mins
2.) Add the chicken mince, salt, chives and pepper to the zucchini and halloumi and use your hands to mix thoroughly together.

5 mins
3.) Shape into 4 evenly sized patties.

7 mins
4.) Preheat a frying pan/skillet over medium-high heat and then add olive oil. Cook the patties in the frying pan for 5-7 minutes each side or until golden brown and cooked through. Can also BBQ instead.

1 sec
5.) Serve immediately.

Ingredients.Name: Very ripe bananas, peeled (about 1 1/4 to 1 1/2 cups mashed)
sugar, can do brown or white sugar
of all-purpose flour, Can sub .5 cup of Whole Wheat flour

Preparation.Step:
1 hr, 5 mins
Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C), and butter a 4x8-inch loaf pan.
In a mixing bowl, mash the ripe bananas with a fork until completely smooth. Stir the melted butter into the mashed bananas.
Mix in the baking soda and salt. Stir in the sugar, beaten egg, and vanilla extract. Mix in the flour.
Optional: Fold in chopped nuts or chocolate chips to taste.
Pour the batter into your prepared loaf pan. Bake for 50 minutes to 1 hour at 350°F (175°C), or until a tester inserted into the center comes out clean.

Remove from oven and let cool in the pan for a few minutes. Then remove the banana bread from the pan and let cool completely before serving. Slice and serve. (A bread knife helps to make slices that aren't crumbly.)

4 hrs, 30 mins
In a large bowl, combine the flour and salt. Add water and honey, and then mix to create a stiff dough. Then gradually add water.
Place the dough on the counter and knead until it’s smooth and supple. Wrap in plastic wrap and refrigerate for 30 minutes.

After 30 minutes, split the dough into 4 pieces. Get one piece, then roll through a pasta machine. Roll using the widest setting, then fold in half and roll again. Do the same on each dough. Repeat this process until you create smooth sheets by gradually decreasing the width on each roll.
When the sheet is at 1mm thick, lay it on the surface and apply a thin layer of lard or butter. Create thin sheets of the other doughs as well and roll them into similar thin layers.
Roll up the first thin sheet to create a tight sausage shape.

Next, wrap the next thin dough sheet around the original sausage shape pastry dough, layering up to create one large cylinder. Cover with a saran wrap and chill for 1 to 2 hours for the pastry to firm up.

Now, to make the filling. Place the milk, sugar, and salt in a sauce pan and bring to a boil. Add the semolina flour until it thickens and becomes smooth. After it has cooled down, transfer to a bowl. Then, add the remaining ingredients, stirring all the while to create a smooth, thick filling. Set aside, preferably inside the fridge.
Preheat oven to 375°F.
Bring out the pastry roll and cut them into 1 cm-thick pieces. Use your fingers, greased with lard or butter, to make an impression on the center to create a cone shape.
Get the filling and scoop a spoonful into the hollow and press the edges of the pastry together to lock. Repeat these for the rest, and line up all pastries on the tray.
When you’re done putting filling on all the dough pieces, bake the pastries for about 30 minutes.
When done, allow to cool for only a couple of minutes before sprinkling them with confectioner’s sugar. Serve immediately.
Preheat oven to 400°F.

5 mins
Cut bacon strips in half. Wrap each date and place seam-side down in a baking dish.

20 mins
Bake for 20 minutes.

20 mins
Turn each one over, and bake for another 10-20 minutes.

Ingredients.Name: whole milk, for extra creaminess use 2 cups milk and ½ cup heavy cream
chopped fresh sage, or ⅛ teaspoon dried ground sage
chopped fresh thyme, or ¼ teaspoon dried thyme leaves
freshly baked biscuits, cut in half

Preparation.Step:
20 mins
Heat the butter in a medium skillet over medium-high heat and cook the onions 10-15 minutes until translucent and beginning to brown. Add the garlic and cook for another minute. Add the veggie sausage and cook for another 3-4 minutes. Sprinkle the flour over the mixture and stir to incorporate, cooking for another 2 minutes.

15 mins
While stirring constantly to prevent lumps, pour in the milk and heavy cream. Stir until smooth. Add the vegetable bouillon, salt, pepper and cayenne. Bring to a simmer and stir until thickened. Add the parsley, sage and thyme and simmer for another 2 minutes. Add salt and pepper to taste.
Serve immediately over the biscuits. Garnish with some chopped fresh parsley.

5 mins
Preheat oven to 350°F.
Place the flour, baking soda, spices, and salt in a sifter, and sift into a bowl. Set aside.

5 mins
In a large bowl, cream together the butter and brown sugar until light and fluffy.

5 mins
Beat in the egg. Then, stir in the molasses.

10 mins
Slowly stir the sifted ingredients into the molasses mixture.

1 hr
Cool the dough in the refrigerator for 1 hour.

10 mins
Shape the dough into 1-inch sized balls, rolling them into the granulated sugar.
Place the cookies a couple of inches apart onto a lined baking sheet, flattening slightly.

10 mins
Bake for 8-10 minutes, letting them cool before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely.

Ingredients.Name: Udon Noodles, Frozen, May Sub with 165 grams Soba Noodles (Dry)

Preparation.Step:
5 mins
Add kombu dashi, mirin, sugar, soy sauce, and salt to a pot and bring to boil. Once boiling, turn off the heat and set aside.

10 mins
Bring a large pot of water to boil then add frozen udon noodles. Cook for 1 minute then strain well. If using dry soba, cook for 5 minutes then strain and rinse well.

2 mins
Serve udon noodles and soup in serving bowls and top with inariage, green onion, daikon, cilantro, ginger and sprinkles of shichimi togarashi.

10 mins
Break 400g milk chocolate into chunks and pop it into a saucepan. Warm on a VERY gentle heat until all of the chocolate has melted (you can do this over a bain marie or in a microwave if you prefer).

15 mins
Put the double cream (100ml), orange liqueur (100ml) and orange extract (¼ tsp) into a large bowl. Once the chocolate has melted, pour it into the liqueur and cream and stir it rapidly until fully combined (you must stir quickly otherwise the chocolate may seize and go lumpy).

3 hrs
Pop it into the fridge to set (mine needed a good couple of hours to be firm enough to roll into balls).

30 mins
Once the ganache is firm roll it into balls about 1″ in diameter. Return the ganache balls to the fridge while you temper your chocolate.

15 mins
Break 150g of milk chocolate into a saucepan and warm on a gentle heat until the chocolate has reached 45ºC. Once it has reached 45ºC remove from the heat (don’t worry if it has’t completely melted, continue to stir it and the remaining lumps will melt in the residual heat).

5 mins
Pour the chocolate into a large bowl.
You now want to bring the temperature of the chocolate down to 32ºC which you do by stirring in the 50g of chocolate you haven’t used yet. Add this chocolate a couple of pieces at a time, stirring continuously. As the chocolate melts, add more pieces until you reach 32ºC. Remove any remaining lumps of chocolate.

Lay out a large sheet of greaseproof paper.
Get your ganache balls from the fridge.

15 mins
Drop a ganache ball into the melted chocolate and use a tablespoon to move it around and ensure it’s all coated. Lift it out using the spoon and the carefully slide it onto the greaseproof paper using the back of a fork.
Repeat until all of your chocolates are coated.

30 mins
Leave for about 30 minutes for the chocolate to set completely (this will be quicker in the fridge but they will set at room temperature as long as it’s not too warm).

15 mins
Heat some water in a saucepan and once boiling reduce the heat to give a gentle simmer. Cover the pan with a bowl (not touching the water) and put 15g of white chocolate into the bowl. Melt until it reaches 45ºC.

5 mins
Once the chocolate has reached 45ºC remove it from the heat and put into a bowl. Add a little orange gel food colouring and then stir in the remaining white chocolate (10g) a bit at a time, until the temperature has fallen to 32ºC.

10 mins
Put the melted white chocolate into a piping bag or bottle and drizzle over the chocolates (if you don’t have a piping bag or bottle then you can also use a fork dipped in the white chocolate and allow it to drizzle over).

30 mins
Leave to set.

Ingredients.Name: tonijn in olie uit blik, uitgelekt

Preparation.Step:
3 mins
Meng de bloem met ruim zout en peper op een groot bord. Prak de tonijn met de currypasta, bosuitjes en het losgeklopte ei in een grote kom.

2 mins
Verdeel het mengsel in vier porties en vorm er koekjes van. Bestuif ze met het bloemmengsel

9 mins
Verhit de olie in een braadpan. Voeg de koekjes toe en bak ze 3-4 minuten aan elke kant, tot ze knapperig en goudbruin zijn.

1 min
Serveer op een bedje van rucola.

Ingredients.Name: small loaf country or sour dough bread
deli sliced mozzarella cheese, or shredded

Preparation.Step: Position a rack in the center of the oven and preheat the oven to 375ºF.

5 mins
Combine the garlic cloves, parsley, and olive oil in a small food processor until the garlic breaks down into small pieces. If you’re using sliced mozzarella, stack the cheese slices and cut into 1 inch squares.

5 mins
Heat the butter over medium heat in a small saucepan. When the butter melts, add the chopped garlic to the butter along with a pinch of salt and allow the mixture to cook for 2 minutes, stirring as necessary so the garlic does not brown. Remove from heat.

20 mins
Using a sharp serrated knife, make 1 inch diagonal cuts across the loaf of bread making sure you don’t cut the bread all the way through. Use a spoon to drizzle the garlic butter into the the cuts of the bread. Stack 3-4 cheese squares and place them in the cuts. Place the garlic bread on a sheet of foil and fold up the sides. Use a second piece to cover the top (we’ll be removing this later). Allow the bread to bake for 10 minutes. Remove the top piece of foil and allow the bread to bake for another 10 minutes or until the cheese melts completely. Serve warm.

Ingredients.Name: bulgur wheat, or Quinoa (to make it gluten-free)
green onions, white and light green parts
finely chopped flat-leaf parsley, I used basil
red wine vinegar, I used white
Zest and juice of 1 small lemon
crumbled feta cheese, Salad is vegan without it, and still good! optional

Preparation.Step:
5 mins
Rinse and drain the bulgur. Bring 1¼ cups water to a boil, add the bulger, turn off the heat, cover and set aside for 25 to 30 minutes or until the liquid is absorbed. Stir in the garlic, fluff with a fork, and set aside to cool.

5 mins
Thinly slice the green onions and add them to a large mixing bowl.

5 mins
Finely dice the strawberries and cucumbers and add them to the bowl.

10 mins
Add the cooled bulgur, mint, parsley, olive oil, vinegar, lemon zest and juice, salt, pepper, and feta and stir everything to mix well.

5 mins
Taste for seasonings and serve chilled or at room temperature.
The tabbouleh will keep covered, in the fridge for 3 days but it's best the day it's made.

5 mins
Wash basil leaves then blanch them in boiling water for 1 minute.

2 mins
Remove and place in an ice bath to cool down.

3 mins
Squeeze out water and dry with paper towel.

5 mins
Place blanched basil, the oil and salt into a blender or food processor and puree.

5 mins
Let it settle a little then pour into a glass container. Use immediately or refrigerate. Flavors are even more intense the next day.

Ingredients.Name: Feta cheese, I prefer the block Feta but crumbled will also work
mayonnaise, good quality such as Hellman's or Duke's
Lemon zest, Finely grated. Approximately 1 lemon zest
freshly ground black pepper, for garnish
extra virgin olive oil, for garnish

Preparation.Step:
10 mins
Combine Feta, yogurt, mayonnaise, lemon zest, lemon juice and garlic in the bowl of a food processor or blender and process for 3-4 minutes or until nice and smooth. Add the olive oil and process until combined.

5 mins
Transfer dip to a serving bowl and smooth out the top. Use a small spoon to create a swirl on the surface. Drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle fresh dill and freshly ground black pepper. Serve with crudités and/or pita chips.

Ingredients.Name: Mushroom Sauce, aka Vegetarian Oyster Sauce

Preparation.Step:
5 mins
Trim 1 inch off the end of the gai lan stalks at an angle and discard.

10 mins
Bring large pot of water (or wok preferably) to a boil then add sea salt, sesame oil & gai lan stalks. Cook for 3 - 5 minutes, depending on preference. Remove gai lan using tongs and place on a plate

2 mins
Combine soy sauce & mushroom sauce. Drain excess liquid from plate then pour sauce over the gai lan and serve.

Ingredients.Name: Rice Vinegar, For Soaking Lotus Roots

Preparation.Step:
2 mins
Thinly slice the lotus root. In a bowl, add rice vinegar and water.

5 mins
Soak the sliced lotus root in vinegar water for 3-5 minutes to prevent discoloration. Then drain the water well.

5 mins
In a large frying pan, heat the sesame oil on medium heat and add lotus root to stir fry.

2 mins
Once the lotus root is almost translucent (80% cooked), add sake, mirin, and sugar. Let the alcohol evaporate (until no more alcohol smell).

1 min
Add in the red chili pepper and soy sauce and stir to combine. We add soy sauce last, as it can easily burnt.

2 mins
When the liquid is almost gone, add sesame seeds and toss all together. Serve hot, lukewarm, or chilled. You can store in the airtight container and keep in the fridge for up to 3-4 days

20 mins
Preheat oven to 350 F°.
Place the cashews, smoked paprika, chili, lime juice, olive oil, honey and salt in a bowl and toss to combine. Spread the cashews on a baking tray lined with parchment paper and bake, turning halfway, for 20 minutes or until golden.
Let the nuts cool completely before serving. You can keep the nuts in an airtight container for up to one week.

15 mins
Squeeze handfuls of spinach to remove as much liquid as possible, then finely chop.

6 mins
Cook onion and garlic in butter in a large heavy skillet over moderate heat, stirring, until soft, 4 to 5 minutes. Add mushrooms, 1/2 teaspoon salt, 1/4 teaspoon pepper, and nutmeg and cook, stirring, 5 minutes. Stir in spinach, then remove from heat.

10 mins
Spread one third of bread cubes in a buttered 3-quart gratin dish or other shallow ceramic baking dish and top evenly with one third of spinach mixture. Sprinkle with one third of each cheese. Repeat layering twice (ending with cheeses).

8 hrs
Whisk together milk, eggs, mustard, and remaining 1/2 teaspoon salt and 1/4 teaspoon pepper in a large bowl and pour evenly over strata. Chill strata, covered with plastic wrap, at least 8 hours (for bread to absorb custard).

1 hr, 30 mins
Preheat oven to 350°F. Let strata stand at room temperature 30 minutes.
Bake strata, uncovered, in middle of oven until puffed, golden brown, and cooked through, 45 to 55 minutes. Let stand 5 minutes before serving.

8 hrs
Stir yogurt, water, and polenta in medium bowl to blend. Cover and let stand at room temperature overnight.

10 mins
Preheat oven to 350°F. Place greased baking pan in oven until hot, about 6 minutes.

15 mins
Meanwhile, sift flour, baking powder, salt and baking soda into large bowl. Stir in brown sugar. Whisk eggs, honey, chipotles, adobo, and melted butter in another large bowl to blend. Stir in polenta mixture. Add to dry ingredients. Stir just until blended. Stir in corn kernels.

45 mins
Transfer batter to prepared hot baking pan. Bake corn bread until tester inserted into center comes out clean and top is golden, about 45 minutes.

15 mins
Transfer to rack. Cool 15 minutes. (Can be prepared 8 hours ahead. Cool completely. Cover and let stand at room temperature.) Cut corn bread into squares and serve warm or at room temperature.

15 mins
Combine the lemon zest, salt and mint in a small bowl.
Press the rub onto both sides of the lamb chops. Leave for up to 30 minutes if you have the time. If not, cook right away.
BBQ at medium heat or pan fry for 5 minutes each side depending on the thickness of the chop and how well done you like them.
